title: 0 GyExo
characteristics_ch1.1: cell line: MIAPaCa-2 human pancreatic cancer cell line
treatment_protocol_ch1: To isolate exosomes, cells were seeded at 1.5 × 10^6 cells per T75 cm^2 flask and irradiated after substituting the media with exosome-depleted 10% FBS cell culture media. The cell culture media was centrifuged at 2,000 × g for 10 min at 4 °C, and the supernatants were filtered through a 0.22-μm minisart syringe filter (Sartorius, Gottingen, Germany). The supernatant was centrifuged at 150,000 × g for 90 min at 4 °C. The pellet was washed with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and centrifuged at 150,000 × g for 90 min at 4 °C and resuspended in 50 μl PBS. After then, exomal RNA samples were extracted.
growth_protocol_ch1: The MIAPaCa-2 human pancreatic cancer cell line was obtained from Japanese Collection of Research Bioresources Cell Bank (JCRB) and maintained in minimal essential medium (MEM; Sigma Aldrich, Merck KGaA) supplemented with 10% (vol / vol) fetal bovine serum (FBS; Sigma Aldrich, Merck KGaA), 1% penicillin-streptomycin mix solution (Nacalai Tesque) and 1% MEM nonessential amino acids solution (100×) (Nacalai Tesque) in a humidified atmosphere containing 5% CO2 at 37 °C.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA samples were extracted from cells using Toray's 3D-Gene RNA extraction regent from a liquid sample kit (Toray Industries Inc., Tokyo, Japan).
label_protocol_ch1: Extracted total RNA was labeled with Cy5 using the 3D-Gene miRNA labeling kit (Toray, Kamakura, Japan)
hyb_protocol: Hybridized for 16 h at 32 C with rotary shake (250 rpm). Hybridization buffer and washing protocol was followed by the protocol supplied by TORAY Industries, Inc..
scan_protocol: 3D-Gene Scanner ((Toray Industries Inc., Tokyo, Japan) was used for scanning. Images were quantified using Extraction(Toray Industries Inc., Tokyo, Japan).
data_processing: The raw data of each spot was normalized by substitution with a mean intensity of the background signal determined by all blank spots’ signal intensities of 95% confidence intervals.
cell line:ch1: MIAPaCa-2 human pancreatic cancer cell line
